title: [FR] Add API to load model input example
body:
Thank you for submitting a feature request. **Before proceeding, please review MLflow's [Issue Policy for feature requests](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md#feature-requests) and the [MLflow Contributing Guide](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst)**.

**Please fill in this feature request template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [X] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

There does not appear to be a Python method to load model input examples. The closest I could find was the internal-only `_read_example()`. This makes it difficult for downstream tools (ex: ML API fuzzers) to leverage those artifacts. Loading input examples is fairly complex given the multiple types of class which can be loaded (numpy, pandas, scipy) and special values to handle (NaNs, etc.), which leads to buggy implementations (I just tried that path...) The proposal is to add a method `Model.load_input_example()` calling `_read_example()` internally.

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature? Load model input examples.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? Unblocks reliably loading examples by tools consuming MLflow artifacts.
- Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? I implemented an input-example loader which is far from handling all edge cases and will lead to a series of bugs to fix. Having an official API to load input examples is a better solution.
- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? (please be as specific as possible about why related MLflow features and components are insufficient) Currently, correctly loading input examples requires copy/pasting `_read_example()` and dependencies from MLflow code.
